title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not make a claim about the area of the intertidal zone a mostly stationary species of intertidal animal that has gills and little pigmentation is best adapted to live in, such as any of the following:

· The organism would likely live in the low tide area that stays covered by water most of the time so gills will function most of the time.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe a government action a conservation group could advocate for that would improve a specific marine regulating ecosystem service, such as any of the following:

· Impose regulations for/spend resources for/educate the public regarding mangrove/estuary/salt marsh protection to prevent coastal erosion/flood control.

· Impose regulations for/spend resources for/educate the public regarding for barrier reef/barrier island/coral reef protection to mitigate storm damage.

· Impose regulations for/spend resources for/educate the public regarding for protection of wetlands for water purification.

· Impose regulations for/spend resources for/educate the public about limiting carbon dioxide emissions to protect the carbon storage ability of the ocean.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify and describe electricity generation by a method associated with coastal areas with high energy needs that has minimal air pollution during electricity production but can impact tourism and property values, such as any of the following:

· Wind energy uses turbines connected to generators to convert the kinetic energy of wind into mechanical and then electrical energy.

· A wind turbine works when wind flows across the blades causing them to spin. The spinning turns the generator which creates electricity.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one drawback, other than impacting tourism and property values, of using the energy source mentioned in part (f) rather than nuclear power to generate electricity, such as any of the following:

· Wind energy is variable/too slow to turn the turbines/too fast to turn the turbines safely.

· Wind energy is less efficient (lower energy density).

· Birds and bats experience mortality risk and turbine avoidance with wind turbines.

· Offshore wind farms are difficult to construct/cause aquatic habitat destruction based on location because they need to be constructed far from shore.

· Wave action and high winds/storms/hurricanes can damage wind turbines.

title: Part I

title: Part J
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify the best flooring type near a south-facing window for a building located around 60 degrees latitude in the Northern Hemisphere and does not explain why the identified flooring type should be used in the building design, such as the following:

· A concrete, brick, stone floor, or ceramic tile that is hit by direct sunlight (southern exposure) would absorb heat during the day keeping the house warmer.
